title: Project Planning and Requirements Gathering
description: Define the project scope, objectives, and requirements, including the specific bodily functions to be optimized, target user groups, and desired outcomes.

title: System Architecture Design
description: Design the overall system architecture for the BioelectronicHealthOptimizer project. This includes detailing the implant hardware, software components, communication protocols, data management strategies, security considerations, regulatory compliance requirements, and ethical considerations. Clearly define interfaces between different components, ensure scalability, and take into account future upgrades and modifications. (1) Detail the design of the implant hardware, including power source, biocompatibility, and wireless communication; (2) Design the software architecture with separate layers for real-time control, data processing, and user interface; (3) Outline the communication protocols used between the implant, smartphone app, and cloud server; (4) Specify data management strategies, including data privacy, encryption, and backup; (5) Address security concerns such as authentication, authorization, and secure data transfer; (6) Analyze regulatory compliance requirements and ensure adherence to these standards; (7) Evaluate ethical considerations and potential risks associated with the device; (8) Consider future upgrades and modifications in the design, making it adaptable for technological advancements. Once completed, update the task status to 'REVIEWED' or 'IMPLEMENTED', depending on the nature of the changes suggested. If significant changes are required, reassign this task to an appropriate team member and change the task status to 'IN_PROGRESS'. Update the 'review_comments' field with your suggestions for improvement if any.

title: Implant Hardware Design
description: Design the physical implant hardware, including biocompatible materials, power sources, sensors, and actuators.

title: Software Development
description: Develop the software components for data processing, optimization algorithms, user interfaces, and communication with external systems.

title: Database Design and Implementation
description: Design and implement the database schema for storing and managing user data, health metrics, and optimization parameters.

title: Security and Privacy Measures: Revised - Review and Update
description: Update the proposed security and privacy measures to protect user data, ensure system integrity, and adhere to relevant regulations. This includes but is not limited to encryption, access controls, regular audits, incident response plans, compliance with GDPR, HIPAA, and other pertinent standards. The implementation should be modular, scalable, maintainable, and future-proof for updates. Additionally, consider the use of privacy-enhancing technologies (PETs) such as differential privacy and federated learning to further protect user data. The architecture should also prioritize secure-by-design principles and employ threat modeling to identify potential vulnerabilities.

title: Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Develop comprehensive test plans and perform rigorous testing, including unit tests, integration tests, and user acceptance testing.

title: Deployment and DevOps
description: Implement deployment strategies, continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines, and infrastructure management for the implant system.

title: Documentation and User Support
description: Create comprehensive documentation, user manuals, and support resources for the implant system.
